intro: Chilita icamolensis, commonly known as the Icamolén wild chile, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, yellow or orange berries. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces a distinctive, spicy fruit used in traditional cuisine. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
